articles.author: Liz Tung
articles.title: What to know about the invasive tick that’s taking over local Pa. forests - WHYY
articles.description: Why researchers say the Asian longhorned tick is spreading so rapidly — and why it could pose a serious threat to human and animal health.
articles.content:
A big part of the reason they’ve managed to spread so quickly, Price said, is that they’re parthenogenetic, which means females are capable of reproducing asexually without the aid of male ticks.
